episode_title: 620 - The One With Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Phoebe is helping Joey rehearse for an audition. Phoebe is overacting her part.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The reactor’s gonna blow in three seconds, we’re never gonna make it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’ve got to get out of here! Save yourself!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! I won’t leave you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t worry about me, I’m a robot! I’m just a machine!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No you’re not! Not to me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God.
content.parenthetical: she stops reading from the script

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I am extremely talented!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you’re great! Okay, let’s take it from…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I mean I was really acting my ass off.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I thought I was pretty good too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, you’re solid. Yeah, you’re just no me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what? I think that’s enough for now. Yeah. I don’t want to be over rehearsed.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine! I’ll do it without you! (Joey gives her thumbs up) I don’t need you or anybody else! I’m gonna make it on my own! (Joey closes the door to his bedroom.) You’ll see!! You’ll all see!!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Joey is memorizing his lines. Chandler, Rachel, and Phoebe are there as well.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So uh, what’s this thing you’re auditioning for?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it’s a new TV show. Yeah. I’m up for the part of Mac Macaveli or “Mac.” Yeah, I’m a detective and I solve crimes with the help of my robot partner. He’s a, he’s a Computerized Humanoid Electronically Enhanced Secret Enforcer or-or “C.H.E.E.S.E.”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s the title! Yeah! Y’know they really lucked out that the initials spell cheese.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That is lucky.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh—Wait so Joey if you get this, you’re gonna be like the star of your own TV show! I mean you’ll be like the Big Cheese! (To Phoebe) Or the Big Mac—Hey! You love those!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, don’t get your hopes up, because probably not gonna happen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now-now, why would you say that Joseph?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I mean come on you guys! My own TV show? I just don’t know if I’m good enough.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I am.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, what are you talking about? You’re a terrific actor.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You really think so?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, how can you even ask that question?!

[And with that we go into the save the budget portion of the show, which features flashbacks from previous episodes. The first set of auditions feature high lights or low lights of Joey’s acting career. The first flashback is from The One With The Lesbian Wedding.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is there to watch Joey’s first scene as Dr. Drake Remoray.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa, she’s pretty. (Mentioning the girl on TV)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, and oh she’s really nice too. She taught me all about how to work the cameras, and smell-the-fart acting.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes you need a minute to remember your next one. So while you’re thinkin’ of it, you take this big pause where you look all intense, you know, like this. (Does this intense look where it looks like he’s smelling a fart.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, ok.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There’s my scene, there’s my scene. [Joey on tv] “Mrs. Wallace, I’m Dr. Drake Ramoray, your sister’s neurosurgeon. I’m afraid the situation is much worse than we expected. Your sister is suffering from a…” (Does the smell-the-fart look.)
[The next flashback is from The One With The Butt. The gang is watching Joey in Freud!]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Vell, Eva, ve’ve done some excellent vork here, and I vould have to say, your pwoblem is qviiite clear. (He goes into a song and dance number.)
content.parenthetical: on stage in an Austrian accent

content.text: [The next flashback is also from The One With The Butt and it’s also on the soundtrack. He’s Joey telling everyone about his big break in Monica and Rachel’s apartment.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I play Al Pacino’s butt. All right? He goes into the shower, and then- I’m his butt.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: C’mon, you guys. This is a real movie, and Al Pacino’s in it, and that’s big!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no, it’s terrific, it’s- it’s- y’know, you deserve this, after all your years of struggling, you’ve finally been able to crack your way into show business.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, okay, fine! Make jokes, I don’t care! This is a big break for me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re right, you’re right, it is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So you gonna invite us all to the big opening?
[Cut back to Joey about to leave for his audition for Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right well, I’m outta here. Wish me luck.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: (singing) Gooood luck! Gooood luck! We all wish you good luuuuuuuuck!!!
content.parenthetical: overacting with a song this time

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, whatever. (Exits.)

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are playing chess and are both studying the board intently.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s your turn.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, are we playing this?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! How’d the audition go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Terrible! I messed up every line! I shouldn’t even be an actor!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute, are you doing that thing where you pretend it didn’t go well but it really did go well?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, did I fool ya?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Totally!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So it did go well.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it went amazingly well!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that’s great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah, it’s down to me and two other guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And I know both of them, they’re really good. One of them is the guy from those allergy commercials who’s always getting chased by those big flowers…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I love that guy! (Laughs.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-oh, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What am I doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m just so nervous! Y’know? The callback isn’t until tomorrow at five. I feel like my head is going to explode!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it is overdue.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, don’t worry. Okay? You’re gonna be fine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There’s just so much pressure. I mean no offense, but what you guys do is very different. I don’t know if you’d understand.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, none of us have to deal with pressure at our jobs.
[Thus starts another series of flashbacks all dealing with the pressure the rest of the Friends have to deal with in their jobs. The first flashback is from The One With The Stoned Guy.]

content.description: Chandler’s office. He’s on the phone, agitated.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, Fran. I know what time it is, but I’m looking at the WENUS and I’m not happy!
[The next flashback is from The One With The Prom Video. Monica is at a job interview at a new restaurant.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, well I’m tearing the lettuce.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Uh-huh. Is it dirty?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh-oh, no no don’t worry, I’m gonna wash it.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Don’t, I like it dirty.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s your call.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: So, uh, what are you going to do next?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I thought that I would cut up the tomatos.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Are they, uh, firm?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They’r alright.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: You sure they haven’t gone bad? You’re sure they’re not very, very bad?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No really, they’re OK.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: You gonna slice them up real nice?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Actually, I was gonna do them jullienne.

content.speaker: Interviewer
content.text: Aaaahhhhhhh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m outa here. [Monica leaves]
[The next flashback is from The One With Rachel’s Crush.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, I’m quitting! I just helped an 81 year old woman put on a thong and she didn’t even buy it! (Pause) I’m telling you I’m quitting! That’s it! I’m talking to my boss right now! (Pause) Yes I am! (Pause) Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Okay bye, call me when you get this message. (Hangs up.)
[The next flashback is from The One With The Dozen Lasagnas, Phoebe is telling everyone but Rachel about the pass Paulo made on her.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, what happened?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he came in for a massage and everything was fine until… (The flashback shows Paulo lying face down on the massage table and slowly moving his hands up Phoebe’s legs and grabbing her butt.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Ohhhhhh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And all of the sudden his hands weren’t the problem anymore. (The flashback shows Paulo rolling over and showing Phoebe his equipment.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Was it…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Boy Scouts could’ve camped under it!
[The next flashback is from The One With Ross’s Sandwich, Ross his confronting his boss about him eating Ross’s sandwich.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You ate my sandwich?

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: It was a simple mistake. It could happen to anyone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh really?

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: Now-now calm down. Come look in my office, some of it my still be in the trash.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?
content.parenthetical: jumping to his feet in anger

content.speaker: Dr. Leedbetter
content.text: Well, it was quite large. I-I-I-I-I had to throw most of it away.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You-you-you-you (trying to remain in control) threw my sandwich away!
[Cut to an outside shot of the museum.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: MY SANDWICH?!!!
content.parenthetical: losing control, we hear him shout outside

content.text: [Cut to a shot of a park.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: MY SANDWICH!!!!!! (Ross’s scream scares a flight of pigeons away.)
[Cut back to Central Perk.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I want this part so much! Y’know? If I don’t get this part I’m never gonna eat Macaroni and Cheese again!—No, I didn’t say that! That’s a lie.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Chandler is there talking to the chick and duck.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on guys, it’s not like I moved to Europe! I just moved across the hall! And we would have you over all the time if it weren’t for (struggles to get this out) Monica’s allergies. (The duck quacks.) You’re right, I could never lie to you. She hates you. (The phone rings.) Should I get that? (Laughs, then answers the phone.) Hello? (Listens) Uh no, Joey’s not here right now. Can I take a message? (Listens) Yeah, okay so the audition has been moved from 5:00 to 2:30? (Listens) Okay great. (Listens.) Bye. (Hangs up the phone and goes to write the message on the Magna-Doodle on the door but Monica walks in and forces him to jump out of the way.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ahh! Aren’t you dressed yet?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Am I naked again?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re supposed to meet my parents in 15 minutes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah okay, I was just talking to the guys. Just look at them I mean, is it okay if they come visit?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wh?! What about my allergies?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh right, your allergies. (Monica leaves and to the chick and duck) All her, she hates you. (Chandler leaves without finishing the message for Joey.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Joey and Chandler are playing foosball and Joey scores a goal.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!! Ha-ha!! All right! Hey! How cool would it be if you could watch like a real life-sized version of this? Huh? I mean how crazy would that be?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: As crazy as soccer?
(The phone rings and Joey answers it.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello? (Listens) What are you talking about? The audition’s not ‘til 5:00! (Chandler suddenly remembers and looks at the unfinished message then tries to sneak over and finish it as Joey listens.) Well, nobody told me! (Listens) Who’d you talk to? (Listens and turns around to see Chandler trying to finish the message.) Nevermind! (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean you didn’t get it from this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The allergy guy got the part! Thanks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, maybe we can fix it y’know? Maybe we can send him some-some big-big flowers and scare him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How could you do this to me Chandler?! This part could’ve turned my whole career around!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I messed up. Okay? I’m sorry, I really messed up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you don’t even live here anymore! What are you doing answering my phone? I have my machine!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Which I bought for ya. Taught ya how to use it. You thought it was a copier. Look, if there was anything I could do, I would do it. Okay? But everybody’s allowed one mistake, right?

[Joey just laughs as a third set of flashbacks featuring Chandler’s mistakes starts. The first flashback is from The One With The Prom Video. It’s Chandler telling Phoebe how much he hates the bracelet Joey bought him. They’re both at Central Perk.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know he coulda gotten me a VCR, he coulda gotten me a set of golf clubs, but no, he has to get me the woman repeller! The eyesore from the Liberace house of crap!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not that bad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah, easy for you to say, you don’t have to walk around sporting some reject from the Mr. T collection. [Joey walks in behind Chandler]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler, Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I pity the fool who puts on my jewelry, I do, I do. I pity the fool that… [turns around and sees Joey] Hi!
[The next flashback is from The One Where Chandler Crosses The Line. He’s telling Joey that he kissed Cathy.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I mean when you were late last night, Kathy and I got to talking, and one thing to another and…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And what?! Did you sleep with her?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No! No! I just kissed her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!! That’s even worse!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How is that worse?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know! But it’s the same!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re right, I have no excuses! I was totally over the line.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Over the line?! You-you’re-you’re so far past the line, that you-you can’t even see the line! The line is a dot to you!
[Cut back to Joey and Rachel’s apartment.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I’m not saying that you should magically forgive me! But you’re not perfect! You’ve made some errors in judgment too!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Name one!

[Chandler proceeds to point out Joey’s errors in this forth set of flashbacks. The first flashback is from The One With The Cat. Chandler has just returned home to see that their apartment has been cleaned out and finds Joey trapped in the entertainment center.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What happened?!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Awww, man! He promised he wouldn’t take the chairs!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What the hell happened?!! How were you locked in?!! And where the hell is all of our stuff?!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didn’t think big enough to fit a grown man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So—You got in voluntarily ?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I was tryin’ to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that guy again, do you know what I’m gonna do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: BEND OVER?!!!
[The next flashback is from The One With The Candy Hearts. Joey and Chandler are waiting at a restaurant as Lorraine and her friend arrive.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, now, remember, no trading. You get the pretty one, I get the mess.

content.speaker: Lorraine
content.text: Hi, Joey. (Sees Chandler.) Well well, look what you brought.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …And what did you bring?

content.speaker: Lorraine
content.text: She’s checking the coats. Joey, I’m gonna go wash the cab smell off my hands. Will you get me a white Zinfandel, and a glass of red for Janice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Janice?
(Lorraine leaves. Joey shakes his head as though to say, ‘It can’t be the same Janice.’ Janice enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Janice?!

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh… my… God.
[The next flashback is from The One With Ross’s New Girlfriend. Chandler is telling Ross and Joey that Joey’s tailor took advantage of him.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey’s tailor…took advantage of me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No way! I’ve been going to the guy for 12 years.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on! He said he was going to do my inseam, and he ran his hand up my leg, and then, there was definite…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Cupping.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s how they do pants! Ross, will you tell him? Isn’t that how they measure pants?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, yes it is. In prison!
[Cut back to the present.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I said name one!

content.description: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe’s, Monica and Rachel are consoling Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe I did this! What an idiot!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, stop beating yourself up! People make mistakes! These things happen! There aren’t any message you’ve forgotten to give me are there? (Chandler has a disgusted look on his face.) Apparently you’re not very good at it! I…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you think he’ll ever forgive me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Of course he will! But Chandler the most important thing is you forgive yourself!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what? I-I kinda have.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Already? That’s pretty bad what you did.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? He will forgive you. And I like to bring a pad with me when I go answer the phone just in case… (Chandler gets that disgusted look back.) Okay…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You didn’t see how mad he was, y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sure he will forgive you. Look, we have all been there! Y’know, you fight, you make up, it’s just the way it works.
[We then go into another set of flashbacks of famous fights. The first is the second breakup of Ross and Rachel from The One With The Jellyfish.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It took two people to break up this relationship!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took full responsibility for!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I didn’t know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I didn’t finish the whole letter!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I fell asleep!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You fell asleep?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was 5:30 in the morning, and you had rambled on for 18 pages. Front and back!! (they go into the living room, trapping Monica, Chandler, and Joey in the kitchen) (to Rachel) Oh-oh-oh, and by the way, Y-O-U-apostrophe-R-E means ‘you are,’ Y-O-U-R means ‘your!’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know I can’t believe I even thought about getting back together again! We are so over!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind it)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And hey! Just so you know, it’s not that common! It doesn’t happen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I KNEW IT!!!!
content.parenthetical: coming out from behind the door

content.text: [The next flashback is from The One After The Superbowl, Part II. Monica and Rachel are fighting over who gets to see Jean-Claude Van Damme.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You had no right to go out with him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is the most ridiculous…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You sold me out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did not sell you out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes you did. You absolutely sold me…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Would you let me talk. [flicks Monica on the forehead]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you just flick me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, well, you wouldn’t let me finish and I was jus- [Monica flicks her back] Ow. That hurt [flicks Monica]
(They keep flicking each other. This turns into slapping each other.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! All right. Now, let’s not do this!
(Rachel tackles Monica onto the couch.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Happy thoughts! Happy thoughts!

(They wrestle on the couch for a little while until Monica gets the upper hand and pulls Rachel off of the couch by her sock. Monica removes Rachel’s sock and starts beating her with it.)This leads to wrestling on the floor. This finally angers Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, now I’m gonna kick some ass.
(Phoebe grabs each of them by an ear.)

content.speaker: Monica and Rachel
content.text: Ow! Ow! Ow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know! I know! I know!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, now I will let go if you both stop.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Fine!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There we go.You know what, if we were in prison, you guys would be, like, my bitches.
[The next flashback is from The One Where No One’s Ready. Joey is retaliating against Chandler hiding his underwear by wearing a whole bunch of clothes.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, buddy-boy. Here it is. You hide my clothes, I’m wearing everything you own.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look at me! I’m Chandler! Could I be wearing any more clothes? Maybe if I wasn’t going commando…
(Chandler does this throat sound.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Whew, it’s hot with all of this stuff on. I ah, I better not do any, I don’t know, lunges. (starts doing lunges)

[The next flashback is from The One Where Eddie Moves In. It’s the sequence where Joey and Chandler are both saddened that they’re not living together anymore. All By Myself is playing in the background.]
[Joey’s place. He goes to say something to Chandler in the other chair but no one’s there. He goes to call Chandler but decides not to and throws the phone back down.]
[Chandler’s. He’s playing foosball by himself.]
[Joey’s. Playing ping pong by himself.]
[Chandler is sitting in front of a window while it’s raining outside. We see Joey through a rainy window. The camera zooms out to show it’s just his tabletop water sculpture.]

content.description: [Scene: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Chandler is entering with a peace offering of a Joey Special, two pizzas.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey? Got you a Joey Special, two pizzas! Joe? (The phone rings and he answers it) (On phone) Hello? (Takes the phone away from his mouth when he realizes what he just did and yells.) Damnit! (Back on phone.) Hello? (Listens.) No, Joey’s not here right now, but I can take a message I think. (Listens) He’s still got a chance for the part?! Oh, that’s great news! (Listens) Well no obviously not for the actor who was mauled by his dog. (Listens) Oh well, that’s great. I will give Joey the message. Thank you! (Hangs up and goes to write the message on the Magna-Doodle .) Yes! (Reading what he’s writing) Okay, Mac audition at 2:00. Allergy actor attacked. (Pause) By dog not flowers.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Joey is entering to find Chandler waiting patiently for him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Please tell me you got the message!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What message?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The actor playing Mac couldn’t do it, they needed to see you at 2 o’clock.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! It’s 6 o’clock!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Du-du-I wrote it, I wrote it on the board! I wrote it on the board, then I went all over New York City looking for ya! I went to Ross’s! I went to the coffeehouse! I went to any place that they made sandwiches!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe this Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry! I-I-I don’t know what to say.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well you-you-you-you might say congratulations! I saw the board! I went to the audition! I got the part!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that supposed to be funny! I was really worried over here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, well I’m uh…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, sometimes that fake out thing is just mean!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh wow! Okay man, I’m sorry. I did not mean to make you feel bad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well that’s good. Because you didn’t! And I’m incredibly happy for ya!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s mean! You really had me going there!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, we could do this all day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you’re right. Okay look, listen, let’s talk about what a huge star I’m gonna be!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are gonna be a huge star! I’m gonna hug ya!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You hug me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right!

[What follows is the final set of flashbacks that feature a whole lot of lovin’ between Chandler and Joey. There’s no words, just hugs and even the kiss from The One With The Monkey. All of this is set to the song, You’ve Really Got a Hold on Me!]
[Cut back to the present, they are still in each other’s embrace.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, do we do this too much?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think so. Yeah, get off me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(They separate.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Joey and Phoebe are reading a scene from Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on C.H.E.E.S.E., I’m not leaving without you! Try routing your backup source through your primary CPU.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t! My circuits are fried! They’re fried I tell you!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! (Back to reading the scene.) Well then I’ll just have to carry you.
(Suddenly Ross jumps up from behind the counter armed with a plastic gun. By the way, he’s overacting too.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’ll be a neat trick, when you’re, (looks at the script) when you’re dead!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross, you don’t have to yell.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There was just an explosion, okay? My hearing would be impaired.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I thought you were excellent! In fact for a minute there I was like, “Ooh, where’d Ross go?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you! And I have to say that first scene when you meet Mac…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God. I mean…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what? I think that’s enough for today. Thanks for your help! (He grabs their scripts and heads for his room.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He’s holding us back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Totally.
